answer_html: \(\int_0^{\pi} \sin^3(x) \,dx=4/3\) and the correct answer is E.
answer_latex: $\int_0^{\pi} \sin^3(x) \,dx=4/3$  and the correct answer is E.
hints_html:
Use the formula

\[\begin{aligned} \sin^2(x) + \cos^2(x)=1.\end{aligned}\]

Then use the substitution that allows you to use the chain rule simply.
hints_latex: Then use the substitution that allows you to use the chain rule simply.
hints_raw:
Use the formula

:<math>\ \sin^2(x) + \cos^2(x)=1.</math>
Then use the substitution that allows you to use the chain rule simply.
question: 1 (d)
sols_html:
We use the substitution

\[\begin{aligned} u= \cos(x)\end{aligned}\]

then we have

\[\begin{aligned} du= -\sin(x) \,dx\end{aligned}\]

and

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle \sin^2 (x)=1-u^2\end{aligned}\]

Therefore

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle \sin^3(x) \,dx = (1-u^2) (-1) du = (u^2-1) du\end{aligned}\]

Consequently

\[\begin{aligned} \int \sin^3(x) dx = \int (u^2-1) du = \frac {u^3} 3 - u = \frac{\cos^3(x)} 3 - \cos(x)\end{aligned}\]

And so we can compute the integral

\[\begin{aligned} \int_0^{\pi} \sin^3(x) \,dx &= \frac{\cos^3(x)} 3 - \cos(x) \Bigr|_0^{\pi} \\ &= (-1/3+1) - (1/3-1)\\ &= 4/3\end{aligned}\]

and the correct answer is E.
sols_raw:
We use the substitution
:<math>\ u= \cos(x)</math>
then we have
:<math>\ du= -\sin(x) \,dx
</math>
and
:<math>\displaystyle
\sin^2 (x)=1-u^2
</math>

Therefore
:<math>\displaystyle
\sin^3(x) \,dx = (1-u^2) (-1) du = (u^2-1) du
</math>

Consequently
:<math>
\int \sin^3(x) dx = \int (u^2-1) du = \frac {u^3} 3 - u = \frac{\cos^3(x)} 3 - \cos(x)
</math>

And so we can compute the integral
:<math>
\begin{align}
\int_0^{\pi} \sin^3(x) \,dx &= \frac{\cos^3(x)} 3 - \cos(x) \Bigr|_0^{\pi} \\
&= (-1/3+1) - (1/3-1)\\
&= 4/3
\end{align}
</math>
and the correct answer is E.
statement_html:
Answer the following multiple choice question. Check your answer very carefully. Your answer will be marked right or wrong (work will not be considered for this problem).

The value of the integral

\[\begin{aligned} \int_0^\pi \sin^3(x) \,dx\end{aligned}\]

is

A. 0

B. 1

C. \(\pi\)/2

D. \(\pi\)

E. 4/3
statement_raw:
Answer the following multiple choice question. Check your answer very carefully. Your answer will be marked right or wrong (work will not be considered for this problem).

The value of the integral
:<math>
\int_0^\pi \sin^3(x) \,dx
</math>
is

:A. 0

:B. 1

:C. <math>\pi</math>/2

:D. <math>\pi</math>

:E. 4/3
